baseline_groups.claim_summary: First-term mayors (eligible for reelection) have lower corruption share (pcorrupt) than term-limited second-term mayors, conditional on observables + state FE. Cross-sectional OLS, N=476 audited Brazilian municipalities.
baseline_groups.notes: Matches Table 4 Col 6 of Ferraz & Finan (2011). Design row run0002 is an exact duplicate of baseline. Block-combo row run0007 (all 6 blocks = baseline) is also an exact duplicate. These are flagged in the spec_map.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: First-term mayors have fewer corruption violations (ncorrupt count) than second-term mayors, conditional on observables + state FE + mandatory control lrec_fisc. Cross-sectional OLS, N=476.
baseline_groups.notes: Matches Table 5A Col 2 of Ferraz & Finan (2011). Design row run0110 is an exact duplicate. Mandatory control lrec_fisc is never dropped across G2 specs.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: First-term mayors have lower corruption violation share (ncorrupt_os, normalized count) than second-term mayors, conditional on observables + state FE + mandatory controls lrec_fisc and lfunc_ativ. Cross-sectional OLS, N=476.
baseline_groups.notes: Matches Table 5B Col 2 of Ferraz & Finan (2011). Design row run0126 and rc/controls/sets/baseline row run0128 are exact duplicates of this baseline. Mandatory controls lrec_fisc and lfunc_ativ are never dropped across G3 specs.

global_notes: All 3 baseline groups from SPECIFICATION_SURFACE.json are present in the results and are coherent.
No spurious baseline groups found. No missing baseline groups.
Treatment variable 'first' is consistent across all 139 rows. No treatment drift.

Outcome drift: G1 has 1 row with outcome 'asinh_pcorrupt' (run0100, rc/form/outcome/asinh) and G2 has 1 row with 'asinh_ncorrupt' (run0121). These are functional-form transforms of the baseline outcome, not concept-level drift. They remain core.

Several exact numerical duplicates exist due to overlapping spec definitions (baseline vs design, block-combo full-set vs baseline, block-combo subsets vs progressive control-set specs). These are noted per-row but remain valid as they represent distinct nodes in the specification tree.
No linked adjustment concerns: all groups use unlinked estimators.
R-squared is NaN for 2 rows: Tobit (run0104, run0137) and NegBin (run0122). This is expected since these are MLE-based models where OLS R-squared is not defined.
